intro: Myoxanthus frutex, commonly known as the creeping myoxanthus, is a low-growing shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, sprawling growth habit. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are typically oval to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are clustered in terminal panicles and are usually pink to reddish in color. Myoxanthus frutex is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
